intro: Cyperus fistulosus, commonly known as the tuberous cyperus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes. The plant has tubers that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. It thrives in wet or marshy environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
